description: Fee Tagging validations for EX-107 attachments.
The format is as follows:
A JSON object with objects named forms, validations and messages
The sub-type-classes object contains forms arrayed for convenience of specifying validations
A form beginning with @ is a reference to the form-class following @ character.
A form-class and resolved references behave as a set (de-duplicating arrayed forms).
Where !not! appears in a set then validation applies if the argument is not in the set.
The validations object contains an ordered array of validation objects.
whose keys name the preferred axes prefixed name (e.g., 'srt:CurrencyAxis'),
and values are a regular expression pattern.
Each validation object contains the following entries:
forms: arrayed forms or form references or single form or form reference,
xbrl-names, elo-names, and severities may be array (plural) or individual
xbrl-names: arrayed dei local names of XBRL elements,
elo-names: optional corresponding arrayed ELO schema names of XML elements,
xbrl-name: single local name of XBRL element,
elo-name: optional single ELO schema name of XML element,
store-db-name: optional ELO db name if elo value to be stored in EDGAR db
store-db-object: optional ELO object for DB parameter passing, e.g., eloValuesFromFacts or submissionFacts
efm: section in EFM, e.g., 6.5.21,
validation: cell reference per FRD (replace below), required except for store-db-name entries
axis: optional, when an element has an axis specification
value: optional, when an element must have a certain value
value-pattern: regex pattern
where: optional, where same-dimensioned facts must have a value or match a pattern,
if value is a list and first entry is an sql regex  operator (~, ~*, !~, !~*) second entry is a regex pattern
else value is a list of matching values for the where-named object of same context as it's subject
value-for-reference-check: optional, when this fact must have a value for referenced fact condition check (default non-nil non-empty)
references: optional, reference to another xbrl-name for dependent or co-dependent validations,
references-value: optional, when a referenced fact must have a certain value
references-where: optional, when where is needed on reference binding
references-exclude: optional, when references should be excluded based on a condition.
eg1. exclude references where (Rule457oFlg is true and FeeAmt is absent) or (Rule415a6Flg and CfwdPrevslyPdFee is absent)
{"ffd:Rule457oFlg": [true], "ffd:FeeAmt": ["absent"]},
{"ffd:Rule415a6Flg": [true], "ffd:CfwdPrevslyPdFee": ["absent"]
eg2. exclude references where (Rule457oFlg is true and FeeAmt is absent and another line exist where Rule457oFlg is true and ffd:OfferingSctyTp is Unallocated (Universal) Shelf)
{"ffd:Rule457oFlg": [true], "ffd:FeeAmt": ["absent"], "!anotherLine!": {"ffd:Rule457oFlg": [true], "ffd:OfferingSctyTp": ["Unallocated (Universal) Shelf"]}},
references-axes: optional, when a separate axes clause is needed for reference binding
references-date-format: optional, applicable when using comparison validation with dates and the reference date is a string.
Specify as a datetime directive matching the reference string date format. eg. %m/%d/%y
source: inline or both
elo-match-message: optional, overrides elo match message, default is dq-0540-{tag}-Value
comment: optional, comment string
skip-if-ft-json: set to true to skip writing validation message when modelXbrl object was loadedFromFtJson
comparison-element-match: optional, a list of xbrl-names that should have matching values when comparing across 2 contexts.
The messages object contains messages which may be referenced by validations
The validation-legend object describes the codes in the validation object @validation value
form-mapping object shows the coded form type along with the english worded version of the form

For filer constructed submissions, the system shall generate a warning message if a filer includes the "Total Fees Previously Paid" amount when there are no Table 1 entries for Fees Previously Paid

sub-type-element-validations.msgCoda: EDGAR will internally process the {tag} to equal the {otherTag}, so that the ffd:NetFeeAmt equals $0. The adjustments are applied for back-end calculation purposes but will not be reflected in the disseminated filing fee exhibit.
sub-type-element-validations.comment-validation:
1. The Fee Exhibit Preparation Tool will provide a warning on the user interface if a filer provides a "Total Fees Previously Paid" amount that is greater than the "Total Registration Fee" amount on the filing for any submission type in Group 4, 6, 8 and 11. For filer-constructed submissions, the system will generate a warning message and accept the filing if a filer provides the "Total Fees Previously Paid" amount that is greater than the "Total Registration Fee" on any submission type in Group 4, 6, 8 and 11.
2.If the "Total Fees Previously Paid" amount is greater than the "Total Registration Fee", and irrespective of whether the filer is claiming an offset or not, EDGAR will update the "Total Fees Previously Paid" Amount to equal the "Total Registration Fee", so that the "Net Fee Due" equals $0 regardless of whether the exhibit was created using the FEPT or as a filer constructed submission.
sub-type-element-validations.comment-exception-handling:
>. The system will notify the filer of the adjusted "Net Fee Due" amount which equals $0 via a warning message, as well as provide in the warning message a statement regarding the amount of the "Total Fees Previously Paid" applied and also note the fact that the adjustments are applied for back-end Commission calculation purposes but not reflected in disseminated documents.
>. The values will not be corrected within the disseminated filing, but the corrected values will be sent to EFMS.
>.EDGAR should save the updated/corrected "Total Fees Previously Paid" and "Net Fee Due" amounts in the database.

sub-type-element-validations.msgCoda: To specify Unallocated Universal Shelf securities (UUS) on a POS AM submission, the previously effective registration statement should be one of S-3, S-4, F-3, F-4.
sub-type-element-validations.comment-validation: A warning should be issued when the underlying previously effective registration statement is not one of S-3, S-4, F-3, F-4.

sub-type-element-validations.msgCoda: Please select Rule 457(o) or 415(a)(6) to specify Unallocated Universal Shelf securities (UUS). Rule 457(o) permits the calculation of the registration fee to be based on the maximum aggregate offering price (MAOP) of all the newly registered securities listed in Table 1. Table 1 must list each of the classes of securities being registered, in tandem with its security type but may omit the proposed MAOP for each class that is part of the UUS.  Following that list, Table 1 must list the security type "Unallocated (Universal) Shelf" and state the MAOP for all of the classes of securities on a combined basis.
sub-type-element-validations.comment: warn if UAS is specified with a rule flag other then 457(o) or 415(a)(6)
sub-type-element-validations.comment-validation: Filers can only rely on Rule 457(o) or Rule 415(a)(6) with "Unallocated Universal Shelf" with noted form types on this row.

sub-type-element-validations.msgCoda: Please select Rule 457(o) to specify Unallocated Universal Shelf securities. Rule 457(o) permits the calculation of the registration fee to be based on the maximum aggregate offering price of all the newly registered securities listed in Table 1. Table 1 must list each of the classes of securities being registered, in tandem with its Security Type but may omit the proposed maximum aggregate offering price for each class that is part of the Unallocated Universal Shelf.  Following that list, Table 1 must list the Security Type "Unallocated (Universal) Shelf" and state the maximum aggregate offering price for all of the classes of securities on a combined basis.
sub-type-element-validations.comment: warn if UAS is specified with a rule flag other then 457(o)
sub-type-element-validations.comment-validation: Filers can only rely on Rule 457(o) with "Unallocated Universal Shelf" with noted form types on this row.

sub-type-element-validations.msgCoda: You have included an Unallocated (Universal) Shelf offering line with no sub-items. There should be at least one additional line with both a Security Type other than Unallocated (Universal) Shelf and a Security Class Title.
sub-type-element-validations.comment: warn if UUS specified without a child item.
sub-type-element-validations.comment-validation:
If an Unallocated (Universal) Shelf parent line is present, validate that at least one "child" row exist for the UUS. If no child row exist, generate a warning. Warning will not convert to a suspension.
Child rows are determined in the following manner
  - UUS parent line is present(Security Type = "Unallocated (Universal) Shelf" and using Rule457(o))
  - The child rows do not have an Amount of registration fee and are using Rule457(o)
sub-type-element-validations.comment-exception-handling:
On the Fee Exhibit Preparation Tool, providing an MAOP on a sub-item for the Unallocated Universal Shelf does not result in a registration fee calculation for that specific sub-item.
For filer constructed submissions, the registration fee on the sub-items line for the Unallocated Universal Shelf must not be provided by the filer or inferred by validation and processing software.

sub-type-element-validations.msgCoda: You have included an Unallocated (Universal) Shelf carry forward line with no sub-items. There should be at least one additional line with both a Security Type other than Unallocated (Universal) Shelf and a Security Class Title.
sub-type-element-validations.comment: warn if UUS specified without a child item on a carry forward.
sub-type-element-validations.comment-validation: Required, except when another line is UUS (then acting as a parent), then this value is optional.

sub-type-element-validations.msgCoda: You are attempting to register Unallocated (Universal) Shelf securities and pay a fee on the POS AM filing. Please note that, in most cases, Securities Act Rule 413 prohibits the registration of securities using a post-effective amendment and no fee is due unless the POSAM registers securities.
sub-type-element-validations.comment-validation:
On a POS AM submission, if a filer selects "Fees To Be Paid", Rule457(o) and security type of Unallocated (Universal) Shelf, display the following warning: 
"You are attempting to register Unallocated (Universal) Shelf securities and pay a fee on the POS AM filing. Please note that, in most cases, Securities Act Rule 413 prohibits the registration of securities using a post-effective amendment and no fee is due unless the POSAM registers securities."

The warning shall not result in or evolve into a suspension.

For these MAOP validations in the 457(f) fee note:
When the registrant receives cash or pays cash in connection with the transaction, validate that the MAOP value of the 457(f) fee note is: --the "Total Value of Securities To Be Received or Cancelled"(the product of "Amount of Securities to be Received or Cancelled" and "Value per Share to be Received or Cancelled") plus the "Cash Consideration Received by the registrant" value minus the "Cash Consideration (Paid) by the registrant" value. If the system calculated value is not equal to filer provided value, use the value provided by the filer but provide warning message.

Check the footnote table MAOP, below, against the offering line MAOP, above the table.

A single 457(f) footnote can apply to/appear with more than one offering line in Table 1.

Therefore, a 457(f) footnote that is not completely filled out (e.g., because a filer will rely on a single other 457(f) footnote that is completely filled out), would result in a warning, never a suspension.

sub-type-element-validations.comment: store-db-action will calculate number of days late.
sub-type-element-validations.comment-validation:
Calculate number of days late to pass to EDGAR in JSON structure based on this rule:

The filing is part of an electronic submission and it includes a filing fee exhibit tagged in inline XBRL format for the payment of an indeterminate number of securities.

The last day for filing the 424I form is the 90th calendar day after the end of the fiscal year (if Item 5 is used) or date on which the issuer ceased operations or was deemed to cease operations (if Item 4 is used). If the due date falls on a weekend or holiday, the filing deadline will be the next business day.

Note: per rule 456(d)(4), if an issuer ceases operations, the date the issuer ceases operations will be deemed to be the end of its fiscal year. When the ceased operations date(item 4) is provided it should be used to determine the number of days late even if the filer also provides a fiscal year end date(item 5).

If EDGAR determines the filing is late, the question "Will this filing be submitted late" will be selected by the system on the Fee Exhibit Preparation Tool and the system shall consider the filing "Not timely."

sub-type-element-validations.comment-validation:
Validate that the"Net Fee Due" amount is:
(a)Total Registration fee minus 
(b) the Total Fee Offsets (up to the amount of the Total Registration Fee), plus
(c) Interest due pursuant to Rule 456(d)(5) if the prospectus is being filed more than 90 days after the end of the issuer's fiscal year.

Note: To generalize the calculation along the following lines: total fee due minus total previously paids minus total fee offsets = net fee due. Elements of the equation that do not apply, would be zero.

Validate the following for Net Fee Due for Groups 4, 6, 11 when no narrative disclosure:
a) Net Fee Due = (Total Registration Fee) - (Total Fees Previously Paid) - (Total Fee Offsets) if filing includes offsets and Fees Previously Paid.

b) Net Fee Due = (Total Registration Fee) - (Total Fees Previously Paid) if filing does not include offsets and includes only Fees Previously Paid

c) Net Fee Due = (Total Registration Fee) - (Total Fee Offsets) If an amended filing includes an offset but no Total Fees Previously Paid

Group 3, 5, 9, 10 when there is no narrative disclosure:

a) If there is an offset amount the Net Fee Due is the Total Aggregate Registration fee minus Total Offsets;

b) If there is no offset amount then the Net Fee Due is the Total Aggregate Registration Fee minus Total Fees Previously Paid, which is zero in this case.

Validate that the Net Fee Due for Group 12 forms = the difference between:
a) the aggregate registration fee for the newly registered securities from the Total Offering Amounts row; and
b) the aggregate fee offsets claimed from the Total Fee Offsets row


Validate the following for Net Fee Due for Group 8:
a) Net Fee Due = (Total Fees Due for Filing) - (Total Fees Previously Paid) -(Total Offsets) ) if filing includes offsets and Fees Previously Paid.
b) Net Fee Due  = (Total Fees Due for Filing) - (Total Fees Previously Paid) if filing does not include offsets and includes only Fees Previously Paid.
c) Net Fee Due  = (Total Fees Due for Filing) - (Total Offsets) if there is an offset and no Total Fees Previously Paid.

Validate the following for Net Fee Due for Group 7:
a) If there is an offset amount the Net Fee Due is the Total Fees Due for Filing minus Total Offsets minus Total Fees Previously Paid.

b) If there is no offset amount, then the Net Fee Due is the Total Fees Due for Filing minus Total Fees Previously Paid.
sub-type-element-validations.comment-exception-handling:
Total Registration fee = "Registration Fee Due (exclusive of any interest due)" or "Total Registration Fees (exclusive of any interest due)""on the filing" as applicable. 
Note: Net Fee Due after 457(p) offsets for a 424(i) filing should be total registration fees, exclusive of interest minus 457(p) offsets (capped at amount of registration fee) plus interest due. [So that 457(p) offsets cannot be used to satisfy required interest payments.]
The FEPT shall automatically calculate "Net fee due after 457(p) offsets" and include this in the generated output. The FEPT will populate this value based on the following calculation: "Total Registration Fees (exclusive of any interest due)" or, if the filer is reporting on a single class, "Registration fee due(exclusive of any interest due)" minus "Total Fee Offsets" plus "Interest due pursuant to Rule 456(d)(5) if the prospectus is being filed more than 90 days after the end of the issuer's fiscal year." Filers can optionally provide this data element as part of the filer-constructed submission.  If "Total Fee Offsets" is greater than "Total Registration Fees (exclusive of any interest due)" or, if the filer is reporting on a single class, "Registration fee due(exclusive of any interest due)," the Net fee due after 457(p) offsets should equal the  "Interest due pursuant to Rule 456(d)(5) if the prospectus is being filed more than 90 days after the end of the issuer's fiscal year." (A 457(p) offset should not reduce the interest component that is due.)

sub-type-element-validations.comment-exception-handling:
Required, non-negative numeric value only if the 424I is filed more than 90 days after the end of the issuer's fiscal year, when Net Sales amount is greater than zero.

The FEPT shall calculate the total amount of registration fee due including any interest due and display the value in the field. The field is non-editable. This value shall be calculated at the filing level and is applicable only if the 424I filing includes interest.

Note: If the the 424I is filed 90 or fewer days after the end of the fiscal year, then the FEPT shall display the same value in Item 17 as Item 15 when no interest is due.

sub-type-element-validations.msgCoda: The EX-FILING FEES exhibit is missing fee data - please include the required narrative disclosure specifying, with respect to a shelf takedown, the maximum aggregate amount or maximum aggregate offering price for the takedown, and/or include fee data in the tables. If not corrected, the submission may require subsequent amendment.
sub-type-element-validations.comment: using fdepglag-any since fany adds to sevCoveredFacts but some of these rule flags are not applicable to the submission types.
sub-type-element-validations.comment-validation:
When the filer has attached an inline EX-FILING FEES, the system shall validate that the filer has included either a narrative disclosure or included Table 1,  Table 2 and Table 3 fee data when submitting N-2 POSASR, POSASR, POS AM, 424B1, 424B2, 424B3, 424B4, 424B5, 424B7, 424B8  filings. The system will generate a warning message, if filers do not include either the narrative tag or the tables (more specifically a Table 1 tag of some sort since Tables 2 and 3 do not always apply)

Note: presence of a narrative disclosure means ffd:NrrtvDsclsr accompanied by either or both ffd:NrrtvMaxAggtOfferingPric and ffd:NrrtvMaxAggtAmt

Note: presence of Tables 1, 2, or 3 data means the presence of nonzero for any of ffd:TtlPrevslyPdAmt, ffd:TtlFeeAmt, ffd:TtlTxValtn and ffd:TtlOffsetAmt

Note: Narrative Maximum Aggregate Offering Price and Amount fields have schema checks on the numeric range.

Note: the table 1 data may have zero fee such as for 457(r) entries, which is a valid table 1 entry and does not trigger a warning.

sub-type-element-validations.comment: save items to database to avoid writing feeAmt into wrong object in usrSty42 validation.

sub-type-element-validations.comment-validation:
The Fee Exhibit Preparation Tool will provide filers the ability to specify if it is a final prospectus for the related offering. For filer-constructed submissions, filers must specify if it is a final prospectus for the related offering. The generated iXBRL exhibit will include the "This is a final prospectus for the related offering" statement as part of the narrative disclosure.

Note 3: The Fee Exhibit Preparation Tool will allow filers to provide only narrative disclosure even if the 424B* filing is NOT a final prospectus for the related offering. In that case, as part of the narrative disclosure, filers are required only to provide narrative disclosure text, and may optionally provide the maximum aggregate amount and  maximum aggregate offering price values.

Note 4: The FEPT system must tag  the "This is a final prospectus for the related offering" statement with its values (Yes, No) in addition to the maximum aggregate amount or maximum aggregate offering price values (if applicable) in this narrative disclosure.

sub-type-element-validations.comment: Debt Validation Rules

sub-type-element-validations.comment-validation:
If the filing is part of an electronic submission and it includes a filing fee exhibit tagged in inline XBRL format, determine the "Total Offering Amount".

If the "Total Offering Amount" is zero or has no value and the following conditions are satisfied, then accept the filing:

i) The submission type is F-1, F-3, F-3D, S-3, or S-3D  b) and has no offering data except offering line(s) where the Security Type is ETVS (Exchange Traded Vehicle Securities), and the Rule is 457(u). 

ii) The submission type is F-1, F-3, F-3D, F-4, F-10, F-10EF, N-14 8C, S-3, S-3D, S-4, S-4EF, S-8, or S-11 and has no offering data except offering line(s) where  Rule selected is "Other".

If the "Total Offering Amount" is zero or has no value, check if the submission type is F-1, F-3, F-3D, F-4, F-10, F-10EF, N-14 8C, S-3, S-3D, S-4, S-4EF or S-11 and it includes Combined Prospectus data, in which case accept the filing. 

In all other cases if the "Total Offering Amount" is zero or has no value,  suspend the filing.
            Note: The "Total Offering Amount" refers to the sum of the Maximum Aggregate Offering Amount Price.

sub-type-element-validations.msgCoda: When the company has a non 811- reporting file number the "Total Offering Amount" must be greater than zero.
sub-type-element-validations.comment-validation:
If the S-1 or SF-1 filing is part of an electronic submission and includes a filing fee exhibit tagged in inline XBRL format, check if the filing has either provided a "Total Offering Amount" (meaning a value is present and non-zero) or Combined Prospectus data (meaning at least one prospectus line in table 3), and accept the filing.  Otherwise if the filing has neither (total offering nor combined prospectus data), suspend the filing except in the following cases:

i) If the submission type is an S-1, and has no offering data except offering line(s) where the Security Type is ETVS (Exchange Traded Vehicle Securities), and the Rule is 457(u) then the system will not perform a check of the "Total Offering Amount", and will accept the filing. 

ii) If the company does not have an 811- reporting file number and the submission type is S-1 or SF-1 and has no offering data except offering line(s) where Rule selected is "Other", then the system will not perform a check of the "Total Offering Amount", and will accept the filing. 

iii) If the company has an 811- reporting file number, then the system will not perform a check of the "Total Offering Amount", and will accept the filing
sub-type-element-validations.comment-exception-handling: EDGAR will provide the reporting 811- file number to Arelle.

sub-type-element-validations.comment: exception a from debt validation rule 6. A narrative disclosure on an N-2 POSASR will not include offeringAxis data. This validation will not trigger.
sub-type-element-validations.comment2: excption b from debt validation rule 6. If only combined prospectus data this validation will not trigger.
sub-type-element-validations.comment-validation:
If the filing is part of an electronic submission and it includes a filing fee exhibit tagged in inline XBRL format, check that at least one of the Security Type fields in "Table 1: Newly Registered and Carry Forward Securities" contains one of these values [Asset-Backed Securities; Debt; Debt Convertible into Equity; Equity; Exchange-Traded Vehicle Securities; Face Amount Certificates; Limited Partnership Interests; Mortgage Backed Securities; Non-Convertible Debt; Other; or Unallocated (Universal) Shelf] with the following exceptions:
a) An N-2 POSASR filing that includes a narrative disclosure, or
b) An F-3ASR, N-2ASR, N-2 POSASR, S-3ASR, or an SF-3 filing that includes only "Combined Prospectus" data (there is no offering data).
If the test fails, then suspend the filing.
sub-type-element-validations.comment-exception-handling: This is the same validation as described in User Story # 15 documented above.

sub-type-element-validations.comment-validation: If the filing is part of an electronic submission and it includes a filing fee exhibit tagged in inline XBRL format, check if the "Total Offering Amount" is greater than zero when Rule 457(a), Rule 457(o), or Rule 415(a)(6) is selected in at least one table 1 line. If not, accept the filing but generate a warning.

If the filing is part of an electronic submission and it includes a filing fee exhibit tagged in inline XBRL format, check if:

If the "Is Fee Table/Fee Exhibit Included?" indicator is set to allow a 424B or 424H variant submission to be fee bearing. If yes, perform the following: check that the filing fee exhibit includes only a narrative disclosure (e.g. no Table 1 data). If yes, accept the filing. If the exhibit does not include a narrative disclosure, check that the "Total Offering Amount" is greater than zero when Rule 457(a), Rule 457(o), or Rule 415(a)(6) is selected in at least one table 1 line. If the test fails then suspend the filing.

Note: per above an offering with just 457(r) is accepted, without warning, with zero total offering amount.

messages.ft-{tag}-Unexpected: for submission type {subType}, {ftContext}, there {severityVerb} not be a value for {tag}.{msgCoda}
messages.ft-{tag}-Missing: for submission type {subType}, {ftContext}, there {severityVerb} be a value for {tag}.{msgCoda}
messages.ft-{tag}-Missing-Amending-Filing: for amending submission type {subType}, {ftContext}, there {severityVerb} be a value for {tag}.
messages.ft-{otherTag}-Missing-Amending-Filing: for amending submission type {subType}, {ftContext}, there {severityVerb} be a value for {otherTag}.
messages.ft-{tag}-Sum: for submission type {subType}, {ftContext}, {tag} {value} {severityVerb} be {expectedValue}, the sum of {item} for all {sumAxes} {values}.
messages.ft-{tag}-{otherTag}-Sum: the sum of {tag}, ({sumValue}), {severityVerb} be {comparison} to the sum of {otherTag}, ({otherSumValue}), for all lines in {sumAxes}; sum({values}) should be {comparison} to sum({otherValues}). Please correct the value(s).{msgCoda}
messages.ft-{otherTag}-Dependency: for submission type {subType}, {ftContext}, since {tagQualifier}{tag} is provided then {otherTagQualifier}{otherTag} {severityVerb} be provided.{msgCoda}
messages.ft-{tags}-{otherTag}-Dependency: for submission type {subType}, {ftContext}, since {tagQualifier}{tags} are provided then {otherTagQualifier}{otherTag} {severityVerb} be provided.
messages.ft-{tag}-Product: for submission type {subType}, {ftContext}, {tag} {value} {severityVerb} be {expectedValue}, the product of {term1} {value1} and {term2} {value2}.{msgCoda}
messages.ft-{tags}-Mutual-Dependency: for submission type {subType}, {ftContext}, all of {tags} {severityVerb} have a {qualifier}value if any of them has a value.
messages.ft-{tags}-Exclusive-Value: for submission type {subType}, {ftContext}, exactly one of {tags} {severityVerb} have a value {value}.{msgCoda}
messages.ft-{tag}-SecurityTypeOrOther-Value: for submission type {subType}, {ftContext}, {tag} is not applicable because there is no Offering other than ffd:OfferingSctyTp value "Exchange-Traded Vehicle Securities."
messages.ft-{tag}-TtlPrevslyPdAmt-Presence: for submission type {subType}, Submission/Fee Summary, {tag} {value} should be the aggregate of the prior payments made to the Commission.
messages.ft-{tag}-{otherTag}-RefValue: for submission type {subType}, {ftContext}, {tag} value {value} {severityVerb} be provided when {otherTag} value is {otherValue}.
messages.ft-{axis}-{tag}-expected-value: for submission type {subType}, {axis}, {tag} with a value of {value} is missing.{msgCoda}
